alert.note: Alert for Elk; Greenwood; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 3:11PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Elk, northwestern Wilson and southeastern Greenwood Counties through 345 PM CST... At 311 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elk Falls, or near Howard, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Howard, Moline, Longton, Severy, Fall River, Elk Falls, Climax, New Albany, Coyville, Fall River Lake, Fall River State Park and Cross Timbers State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
